pageContext.claim: “In Texas you heard we won the case [on Obamacare], now it has to be appealed and then we will go to the United States Supreme Court.”
pageContext.analysis: The Trump administration originally did not seek a sweeping repeal of the Affordable Care Act. It simply asked that the court nullify provisions that protected people with preexisting conditions. So court ruled beyond the position taken by the administration. But Trump now declares that is a win. Refusing to defend the law already was a flip-flop from Trump's pledge to retain protections for people with existing health conditions. Few legal experts believe the ruling will survive the appeal process.
